adverbs.description: lumpily (comparative more lumpily, superlative most lumpily)

entries.meaning: In a lumpy manner, with lumps.
examples: I had no idea that anything in the shape of a horse could be so limp as that, either living or dead. His wild mane hung down lumpily, a mere mass of inanimate horsehair; his aggressive ears had collapsed, but as he went swaying slowly across the front of the bridge I noticed an astute gleam in his dreamy, half-closed eye.

entries.meaning: Like a lump; awkwardly, heavily, ponderously.
examples: “You’ll feel better when you’ve drunk this’m,” said the parlourmaid lumpily, pouring out some tea.
